description.narrative: International Defence Education is recognised as a key element of Defence Engagement- impacting and contributing to Defence Diplomacy including capacity building, security sector reform, conflict prevention and stabilisation. The Defence Education programme aims to provide future leaders of international service personnel, police and civilians in the security sector with the skills that will enable them to make effective contributions to long-term institutional reform, conflict prevention and regional security. ﾠDefence Education benefits a broad variety of countries around the world and covers a range of courses, for each of which a different proportion is ODA eligible, reflecting the relevance to ODA purposes.

Strategic Leadership Programme: This is a short course for military and civilian personnel, which seeks to improve leadership skills, and encourage participants to exercise leadership in a responsible manner which reflects human rights, rule of law, democratic control and civilian oversight. Aspects of the course also touch on delivery of humanitarian assistance and disaster relief, anti- corruption and transparency, and international humanitarian law. Relevant aspects of the course are reported as ODA. ﾠﾠﾠ
